column5: After 9 days of working, driving and tying jigs to keep up with the orders, I finally got a chance to hit the South Shore.  Started in 79 feet with a spoon and marked just 1 fish in an hour, moved to 112 feet, missed one on one of my jigs and it was dead again.  I moved to 106 and managed a nice little 4 pounder, natural, so back she went.  Made a move to 82 and hit the jackpot, I landed 4 more in just under 45 minutes.  My new jig took a beating.  Brought home 2 stockers for the smoker.  I've added pics of the jigs to my site for those interested! Scroll to the bottom  IMPACT! Fishing Co.
Great job Steve Got to love landing a few beauties on your own creation You must be proud of it.... congrats Thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice job!  Great looking lures.  I think I'll be putting in an order for some harnesses for spring eyes!  Good luck on the venture!  cheers.
Nice fish, sent you a PM
Let me know and I'll tie some up.  Havent tied em for a while, now I'm excited hahaha
